              Vincent Bagilet
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                         Email
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                         GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Hi and welcome to my personal website!
            I am a fourth year PhD student in Sustainable Development at Columbia University.
            My main research interests revolve around the determinants of environmental attitudes of individuals. I use observational data to study to what extent social norms, public policies and peer effects can affect the environmental consumption behavior of individuals. Overall, I am particularly enthusiastic about the use of unconventional data sources to analyze environment related issues.
            Prior to joining Columbia, I earned masters in Quantitative Economics from the Paris School of Economics, in Environmental Economics from University Paris Saclay/AgroParisTech and in Engineering with a specialization in Energy from Ecole Centrale Lyon.

articles.title: Projects
articles.description: A list of short and simple descriptions of some of my projects.

articles.title: Research
articles.contents:
I am currently working on a few projects on the determinants of environmental attitudes of individuals. They are still at an embryonic stage but I will share my progresses here as soon as my projects are more developed and polished. I am also currently working on a couple of projects linked to causal inference methods.
Work in progress


Inference Design In Studies on Acute Health Effects of Air Pollution
Paper with Léo Zabrocki.
The last version of the working paper can be downloaded here.
The project website can be accessed here.















Unbiased but Inflated Causal Effects
Paper with Léo Zabrocki.
